oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1960-12-10 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from December 10, 1960. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Jim Reeves (host/performer), guest performers the Louvin Brothers, and regular performers Archie Campbell, June Carter, the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Hank Garland, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1105th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jim Reeves; Archie Campbell; June Carter; Louvin Brothers; Jordanaires; Tommy Jackson; Hank Garland
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Jim Reeves -- In A Mansion Stands My Love (Jim Reeves) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner) -- Jim Reeves introduces Archie Campbell -- Comedy routine (Archie Campbell, June Carter) -- Jim Reeves introduces the Louvin Brothers -- It's Christmas Time (Louvin Brothers, Jordanaires) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Jim Reeves) -- Grant Turner introduces Tommy Jackson -- Snowflake Reel (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Grant Turner introduces Jim Reeves -- An Evening Prayer (Jim Reeves, Jordanaires) -- Jim Reeves introduces Hank Garland -- The World Is Waiting For The Sunrise (Hank Garland, Jordanaires)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Smathers, Ben, -1990; Stoney Mountain Cloggers; Jackson, Tommy; Campbell, Archie; Cash, June Carter, 1929-2003; Garland, Hank, 1930-2004; Wood, Del; Jordanaires (Musical group); Reeves, Jim; Louvin Brothers; Louvin, Charlie, 1927-2011; Louvin, Ira, 1924-1965; Price, Ray, 1926-2013
